qas.question: Where did Baptist missionaries take an active role in the anti-slavery movement?
Who was a prominent British Baptist missionary in Jamaica?
Where did William Knibb work toward the emancipation of slaves?
Knibb also protagonised the creation of what?
What was named after the slave port of Calabar?
Where did Baptist missionaries not take a role in the anti-slavery movement?
Who was a prominent British Baptist missionary in America?
What was the slave port of Calabar named after?
William Knibb protagonised the destruction of what?

context: Elsewhere in the Americas, in <a0_0><b5_0>the Caribbean<b5_0/><a0_0/> in particular, Baptist missionaries took an active role in the anti-slavery movement. In Jamaica, for example, <a1_0><b6_0>William Knibb<b6_0/><a1_0/>, a prominent British Baptist missionary, worked toward the emancipation of slaves in <a2_0>the British West Indies<a2_0/> (which took place in 1838). Knibb also protagonised the creation of "<a3_0><b8_0>Free Villages<b8_0/><a3_0/>"; rural communities centred around a Baptist church where emancipated slaves could farm their own land. Baptists were likewise active in promoting the education of former slaves; for example, <a4_0><b7_0>Jamaica's Calabar High School<b7_0/><a4_0/>, named after the slave port of Calabar, was formed by Baptist missionaries. At the same time, during and after slavery, slaves and free formed their own Spiritual Baptist movements - breakaway spiritual movements which often expressed resistance to oppression.
